Shares of several basic material companies are trading higher on renewed trade optimism. White House Economic Advisor Larry Kudlow said the December tariffs could be removed if U.S.-China trade talks go well.
Benzinga's Top Upgrades, Downgrades For October 16, 2019
Wells Fargo Initiates Coverage On Ferro with Market Perform Rating, Announces $12 Price Target

Shares of several basic material companies are trading higher after President Trump made positive remarks on the U.S.-China trade talks as traders grew more optimistic over the possibility of a limited trade deal. Trump is scheduled to meet with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He at the White House today.

Shares of several basic material companies are trading lower as optimism around the upcoming U.S.-China trade talks waned. A report says China is toning down its expectations of the meeting. The U.S. expanded its trade blacklist, and scheduled an increase in tariffs on $250 billion worth of Chinese goods from 25% to 30% on Oct. 15, which will go into effect if no progress is made.
